page.title: 04THE POST OFFICE,HASELOR WARK
page.content: We went to Mrs. Ryman to ask her about the Post Office. She told us that the building was about 400 years old. The only change that she could think of concerning the house was that it was once thatched and now it has a tin roof. The shop took up one small part of her house. It was a little difficult for customers when more than two called at once because there was no room for more than two at a time. She sold about 100 stamps a week but she also sold sweets, chocolates, cards, cigarettes and other small items. Her best selling item was the cigarettes but she sold crisps and sweets to the children. She remembers being burgled twice.
